title: Secure Coding Practices

description.medium: Master OWASP Top 10 defenses, input validation, output encoding, authentication/authorization, injection prevention, XSS/CSRF protection, and cryptography to build secure applications from the ground up
description.full: Secure coding prevents vulnerabilities at the source code level. This covers the OWASP Top 10 (injection, broken access control, cryptographic failures, XSS, etc.), input validation and sanitization, output encoding, authentication and authorization patterns, parameterized queries, error handling that doesn't leak information, dependency security, and integrating security testing (SAST/DAST) into development workflows.

why_it_matters: Security vulnerabilities lead to data breaches and regulatory penalties
It's far cheaper to prevent vulnerabilities than fix them in production
User trust depends on protecting their data
Compliance requires secure coding (PCI-DSS, HIPAA, SOC 2)
Attackers actively scan for common vulnerabilities

objectives: Avoid the most critical vulnerabilities (SQL injection, XSS, hardcoded secrets)
Validate all input and encode all output
Use parameterized queries instead of string concatenation
key_takeaways: Never trust user input - validate and sanitize everything
Use prepared statements for database queries
Let frameworks handle security (don't roll your own crypto)

objectives: Apply defense in depth with multiple security layers
Use security headers and Content Security Policy
key_takeaways: Every OWASP Top 10 item has code-level defenses
Allowlist validation is safer than blocklist
Context-aware output encoding (HTML, JS, URL, CSS)
Security testing (SAST) catches issues before code review

objectives: Design application security programs and secure SDLC
Map code-level controls to compliance requirements
key_takeaways: Security champions program scales secure coding across teams
Automated security testing in CI/CD prevents regressions
Threat modeling informs code-level security decisions

estimated_time_to_implement.mid_depth: 4-8 weeks to implement OWASP Top 10 defenses
estimated_time_to_implement.deep_water: 6-12 months to build mature AppSec program

common_mistakes: Leaking sensitive information in error messages
Storing passwords in plaintext or with weak hashing
success_metrics: Time to remediate vulnerabilities (< 30 days for critical)
SAST/DAST findings trend (should decrease over time)
when_to_deprioritize: Internal tools with no sensitive data
Offline applications with no network access
